com.pump.io

Class LookAheadReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • com.pump.io.LookAheadReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable

    public class LookAheadReader
extends java.io.Reader
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This reads data but also provides a couple of convenient .peek() methods to look ahead. My compiler professor would consider this approach to parsing "cheating", but I think it makes the code more readable.

    The internals of this class use an array-backed circular queue.

        public char current()

      • peek

        public char peek(int length)
        Peek at a character several characters ahead.
        Parameters:
        length - the number of characters to look ahead. If this is zero, then this method is equivalent to current(). If this is one, then this returns the Character after current(), etc.
        Returns:
        the character that is length-many spaces ahead, or CharacterIterator.DONE if the end of the character stream is reached.

      • next

        public boolean next()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Cycle to the next character.
        Returns:
        true if a new character is available, false if we've reached the end of the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • skipLineBreak

        public boolean skipLineBreak()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Skip the current line break, if any.

        This looks for any of the following 3 combinations: \n, \r, or \r\n .

        public java.lang.String readLine(int charLimit)

        Read one line of text from this reader.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a line of text
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurred reading data, or if the charLimit was exceeded, or an EOFException.

      • peekWord

        public java.lang.String peekWord(boolean includeLetters,
                                 boolean includeDigits,
                                 boolean includeOtherNonWhitespace)
        Peek at remaining characters.
        Parameters:
        includeLetters - if true then letters are allowed/included.
        includeDigits - if true then digits are allowed/included.
        includeOtherNonWhitespace - if true then other characters (such as punctuation) are allowed/included.
        Returns:
        a peek of the next available word.
